title: Whatever happened to ... Hong Kong pro-democracy protests?
description: Protests began following the passage of controversial legislation that allowed for suspected criminals to be sent to China for trial. The protests were seen as a "watershed" moment for Hong Kong as millions took to the streets.

title: Speaker Kevin McCarthy has shown 'abilities' no one thought he had: Karl Rove
description: Fox News contributor Karl Rove breaks down the negotiations between the Republican Party and Democratic Party on the debt ceiling bill on "Your World with Neil Cavuto."

title: Burma's UN special envoy to resign in June
description: The U.N. special envoy for Burma, Noeleen Heyzer, will resign from her post in June, the international governing body announced Wednesday.

title: Surprise package for future grandma comes disguised as PR ploy — Oh, baby!
description: A soon-to-be new mom harnessed the power of social media to deliver a surprise to her mother-in-law for a special family announcement — watch the new grandma's reaction!

title: North Hollywood parent boycotting school's pride assembly, says its inappropriate topic for kids under ten
description: A North Hollywood parent told Fox News Digital the school district should not be teaching minors about LGBTQ issues.

title: Pistons willing to make Monty Williams one of NBA's highest-paid coaches in heavy pursuit: report
description: The Pistons are reportedly "heavily pursuing" former Phoenix Suns head coach Monty Williams, and they're willing to break to bank to make him one of the NBA's highest-paid coaches.

title: Gulf Coast Walmart arsonist sentenced to 18 years
description: Jeffrey Sikes, who was convicted of masterminding a scheme that involved arson attacks on multiple Walmart stores along the Gulf Coast, has been sentenced to 18 years in prison.

title: Climate change not to blame for triple-whammy cyclones, floods ravaging Italy: researchers
description: Three back-to-back cyclones that led to deadly floods across northern Italy cannot be attributed to manmade climate change, a study by the World Weather Attribution found.

title: South Carolina man robs convenience store clerk using toy Nintendo 'Duck Hunt' pistol

description: Members of Congress told Fox News that they read the latest bill to suspend the debt limit after a deal was reached with President Biden and House Speaker Kevin McCarthy.

title: WI man pleads guilty to 11-year-old's fatal shooting, prosecutors eye 20-year sentence
description: Jerry Ward of Madison, Wisconsin, pleaded guilty Wednesday to the first-degree reckless homicide of 11-year-old Anisa Scott in a deal with prosecutors.

title: Alex Rodriguez shares cautionary tale after receiving common health diagnosis: ‘Take care of your teeth’
description: Alex Rodriguez is cautioning Americans to 'take care of your teeth' after revealing Wednesday that he's been diagnosed with early-stage gum disease.

title: Penske Entertainment replacing fan's vehicle damaged by flying tire at Indy 500

title: Latvia's Rinkēvičs elected president, first openly gay leader in the Baltics
description: Latvia's popular foreign minister, Edgars Rinkēvičs, has been elected president by the Baltic nation's parliament, succeeding retiring incumbent Egils Levits

description: Nauman Hussain, the 33-year-old operator of a limousine company whose poorly-maintained vehicle killed 20 in a 2018 wreck, has received a prison sentence of 5 to 15 years.

title: Jon Rahm says LIV golfers should be eligible for Ryder Cup: 'Best Europeans against best Americans, period'
description: Thanks to defecting to LIV Golf, several members of the 2021 European Ryder Cup team likely will not be participating in this year's event.

description: Former President Trump's call to end automatic birthright citizenship is likely to face significant opposition should he make such a move.

title: Man asks if he's wrong for bringing his dog to the gym, sparking debate on Reddit
description: An anonymous man on Reddit is asking the public if he's wrong for bringing his dog to the gym even though there's no policy in place prohibiting the act.

description: Thanks to Brooks Koepka's win at the PGA Championship and his T2 finish at the Masters, he could automatically qualify for the 2023 Ryder Cup.
